required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating the Impact of a Value-based Prescription Drug Formulary
clinical_study.official_title: Value-based Formulary-Essentials: Testing and Expanding on Value in Prescription Drug Benefit Design

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the impact of the value-based formulary on patient out-of-pocket spending and health plan spending as well as the impact of the value-based formulary on medication use, emergency department visits, hospitalizations, and outpatient office visits.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 months before insurance transition until up to 36 months after transition
primary_outcome.description: Impact of value-based formulary on patient out-of-pocket plus health plan spending on prescription drugs per member per month

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient out-of-pocket spending for prescription drugs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 months before insurance transition until up to 36 months after transition
secondary_outcome.description: Impact of value-based formulary on patient out-of-pocket spending for prescription drugs per member per month

secondary_outcome.measure: Health plan spending for prescription drugs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 months before insurance transition until up to 36 months after transition
secondary_outcome.description: Impact of value-based formulary on health plan spending for prescription drugs per member per month

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 months before insurance transition until up to 36 months after transition
secondary_outcome.description: Impact of value-based formulary on total healthcare spending per member per month

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 months before insurance transition until up to 36 months after transition
secondary_outcome.description: Impact of value-based formulary on number of emergency department visits per member per month

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 months before insurance transition until up to 36 months after transition
secondary_outcome.description: Impact of value-based formulary on number of days in hospital per member per month

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 months before insurance transition until up to 36 months after transition
secondary_outcome.description: Impact of value-based formulary on number of outpatient office visits per member per month

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 months before insurance transition until up to 36 months after transition
secondary_outcome.description: Impact of value-based formulary on days supply of medication per member per month

arm_group.description: enrolled in a standard (i.e., non-value-based formulary)

intervention.description: Prescription drug formulary tiers informed by estimated value

study_pop.textblock: All individuals who satisfy the eligibility criteria are included.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Individuals:
- aged 0-64
- Continuously enrolled in an employer-sponsored health plan for at least 12 months (with one-month allowable gap) prior to the index date
- For individuals in the exposed group, the index date is defined as the start date of value-based formulary implementation at the employer group level
- For individuals in the control group, the index date is defined as the index date of the matched exposed individual
- Employer groups:
- that transition to the value-based formulary if they transitioned all enrollees in that employer group (no individual selection)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Individuals with:
- missing gender information
- missing zip code level demographics at all member months

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data will not be made available per data use agreement.
